result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan P. Hubbard

records.addlTxt:
1:56 PM Defendant Ryan P. Hubbard in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Ryan P. Hubbard.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana requests a preliminary hearing.  Matter reset.  Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

12:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan P. Hubbard in court.  Court notes DE was to have IH paperwork completed and filed.  Recess to find those docs as DE states he just filed them w/the COC's office.  Back on the record at 1:24 pm.  Docs have now been filed/scanned.  Court reviews those docs and questions DE on his petition.  DE is unemployed and has no income - thinks he may not qualify because of equity in his home.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana (608) 448-4109.  To reimburse COC's office $100/month beginning on or before 10/1/22 and then by the first of each month thereafter.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Court resets PTC/RD.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Petition for Appoitnment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan P. Hubbard in court.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes DE filed PE for court-appointed counsel but it's not completed.  Court will reset the IH and RD to next week so DE can fill that paperwork out if he still wants the Court to consider appointing counsel for him.  DE states he's not employed - he stays at home w/the children and his wife works.
Return date scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Indigency hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Indigency hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan P. Hubbard not in court.  Court notes DE contacted the Court to advise he was running late.  Matter will be recalled at 2:30 today.  Recalled at 2:05 PM.  Prosecuting attorney, Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan P. Hubbard in court.  DE does not qualify for PD appointment and does have paperwork for court appointed counsel but may qualify for some veteran legal services.  DE advised of upcoming court dates.

No possession of firearms. Absolute Sobriety. No alcohol. Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.

3:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan P. Hubbard appeared by video, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. DE does not qualify for PD representation.   Advised of rights to an attorney.  State requests Signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No possession of firearms. Absolute Sobriety. No alcohol.  No possession of any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
